intro: Riedelia suborbicularis, commonly known as the orbicular riedelia, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its orbicular, or nearly round, leaves that are often hairy and have a distinctive appearance. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. Riedelia suborbicularis is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique foliage and delicate floral display.
